issue.title: [C++] Add timestamp subtract kernel aliased to int64 subtract implementation
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-8934](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8934). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
We can use the same scalar exec function for int64 subtraction as well as `(array[TIMESTAMP], array[TIMESTAMP]) -> duration`.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8934?focusedCommentId=17124032) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
We must be careful not to instantiate unnecessary templates when doing this

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8934?focusedCommentId=17143486) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 7530
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7530>
